a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $\sin(\theta)$ and $\tan(\theta)$ are both not equal to zero, show that $\left(\frac{\csc(\theta)}{\sin(\theta)}\right) - \left(\frac{\cot(\theta)}{\tan(\theta)}\right) = 1$

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "cos theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(1 / sin theta) / sin theta - (cos theta / sin theta) / (sin theta / cos theta) = 1"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "cos theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(1 / sin theta) / sin theta - (cos theta / sin theta) / (sin theta / cos theta) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Simplify the following expression given that neither sine nor cosine of theta is zero: $\frac{1}{\sin^2\theta} - \frac{\cos\theta}{\sin\theta} \div \frac{\sin\theta}{\cos\theta}$. The final answer is $1$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Prove that when sine and tangent of an angle theta are not zero, the equation $\frac{\csc(\theta)}{\sin(\theta)} - \frac{\cot(\theta)}{\tan(\theta)} = 1$ holds true.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real and csc cot sin tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> theta. sin theta = 1 / csc theta"
and h1 : "\<forall> theta. tan theta = 1 / cot theta"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real and csc cot sin tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> theta. sin theta = 1 / csc theta"
and h1 : "\<forall> theta. tan theta = 1 / cot theta"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given that $\sin(\theta) = \frac{1}{\csc(\theta)}$ and $\tan(\theta) = \frac{1}{\cot(\theta)}$, find the value of $\frac{\csc(\theta)}{\sin(\theta)} - \frac{\cot(\theta)}{\tan(\theta)}$. The final answer is $1$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc theta / sin theta) - (cot theta / tan theta) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: If sine and tangent of an angle theta are not equal to zero, show that $(\frac{1}{\sin{\theta}} / \sin{\theta}) - (\frac{1}{\tan{\theta}} / \tan{\theta}) = 1$.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes \<theta> :: real
assumes h0 : "sin \<theta> \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan \<theta> \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc \<theta> / sin \<theta>) - (cot \<theta> / tan \<theta>) = 1"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes \<theta> :: real
assumes h0 : "sin \<theta> \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "tan \<theta> \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(csc \<theta> / sin \<theta>) - (cot \<theta> / tan \<theta>) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: "If the sine and tangent of an angle are both nonzero, prove that the value of the expression (cosecant of the angle divided by sine of the angle) minus (cotangent of the angle divided by tangent of the angle) is equal to 1."

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "cos theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(1 / sin theta / sin theta) - (cos theta / sin theta / (sin theta / cos theta)) = 1"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $\frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta}.$ The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{\csc \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cot \theta}{\tan \theta} &= \frac{1/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta} - \frac{\cos \theta/\sin \theta}{\sin \theta/\cos \theta} \\ &= \frac{1}{\sin^2 \theta} - \frac{\cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} \\
 &= \frac{1 - \cos^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \frac{\sin^2 \theta}{\sin^2 \theta} = \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin theta \<noteq> 0"
and h1 : "cos theta \<noteq> 0"
shows  "(1 / sin theta / sin theta) - (cos theta / sin theta / (sin theta / cos theta)) = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
